meanings.definition: To become covered with cork or corky tissue.
meanings.sent1: The tree was slowly suberising as the corky tissue formed on its trunk.
meanings.sent2: After many years, the old wine bottle started suberising, developing a corky layer on its surface.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome decided to start suberising himself with cork to blend in better with the trees.
meanings.sent4: As time passed, the abandoned house seemed to be suberising, resembling a giant cork in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent5: The artist's sculpture was suberising beautifully, with the corky texture giving it a unique and natural look.

meanings.definition: To treat or coat with cork or corky tissue.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman was suberising the edges of the table with cork to protect them from damage.
meanings.sent2: She carefully suberised the handle of the knife, ensuring a comfortable grip with the cork coating.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to suberise the pan with cork, hoping it would give the food a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The gardener suberised the plant pots with cork, creating a rustic and charming display in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter was suberising the chair legs, adding a touch of elegance with the cork coating.
